com.mateolegi.rostrum

Class EntityFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mateolegi.rostrum.EntityFactory

  • public class EntityFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    It fulfills the function of transforming the generic objects returned by the native JPA queries in a POJO with the required attributes.
    Version:
    2.1.0
    Author:
    Mateo Leal

    • Method Detail

      • reflect

        public static <T> T reflect(java.lang.Object o,
                            java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Transforms a returned object through a native JPA query in a POJO. The POJO must have a constructor with the parameters and the order of the query.
        Type Parameters:
        T - POJO class to be returned
        Parameters:
        o - object returned by the native query
        clazz - POJO class
        Returns:
        POJO with the information of the object

      • reflectList

                                                java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Transforms a returned object by a native JPA query into a POJO. The POJO must have a constructor with the parameters and the order of the query.

        Parameters:
        o - object returned by the native query
        clazz - POJO class

      • reflect

        public static <T> T reflect(@NotNull(value="Query can\'t be null")
                            @NotNull(value="Query can\'t be null") javax.persistence.Query query,
                            java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Execute a query and map the result to a DTO. Return a single result, if the query returns more than one record or no record, the exceptions of Query are thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        T - entity type
        Parameters:
        query - query after assigning parameters
        clazz - class to which you want to transform the result of the query
        Returns:
        instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if query is null
        javax.persistence.NoResultException - if there is no result
        javax.persistence.NonUniqueResultException - if there is more than one result
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if it is called for an UPDATE or DELETE statement from the Java persistence query language
        javax.persistence.QueryTimeoutException - if the execution of the query exceeds the value of the query timeout and only the instruction is reversed
        javax.persistence.TransactionRequiredException - if a blocking mode other than NONE has been set and there is no transaction or the persistence context has not joined the transaction
        javax.persistence.PessimisticLockException - if the pessimistic blockade fails and the transaction is reversed
        javax.persistence.LockTimeoutException - if the pessimistic blockade fails and only the instruction will be reversed
        javax.persistence.PersistenceException - if the execution of the query exceeds the timeout value of the query and the transaction rolls back
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • reflect

        public static <T> T reflect(@NotNull(value="Query can\'t be null")
                            @NotNull(value="Query can\'t be null") javax.persistence.Query query,
                            java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                            java.util.function.Function<javax.persistence.NoResultException,T> noResultExceptionCallback)
        Execute a query and map the result to a DTO. Returns a single result, if the query returns more than one record or no record, the exceptions of Query are thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        T - entity type
        Parameters:
        query - query after assigning parameters
        clazz - class to which you want to transform the result of the query
        noResultExceptionCallback - function that will be executed in the case that query does not get results
        Returns:
        instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if query is null
        javax.persistence.NonUniqueResultException - if there is more than one result
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if it is called for an UPDATE or DELETE statement from the Java persistence query language
        javax.persistence.QueryTimeoutException - if the execution of the query exceeds the value of the query timeout and only the instruction is reversed
        javax.persistence.TransactionRequiredException - if a blocking mode other than NONE has been set and there is no transaction or the persistence context has not joined the transaction
        javax.persistence.PessimisticLockException - if the pessimistic blockade fails and the transaction is reversed
        javax.persistence.LockTimeoutException - if the pessimistic blockade fails and only the instruction will be reversed
        javax.persistence.PersistenceException - if the execution of the query exceeds the timeout value of the query and the transaction rolls back
        Since:
        2.1.0

      • reflect

        public static <T> T reflect(@NotNull(value="Query can\'t be null")
                            @NotNull(value="Query can\'t be null") javax.persistence.Query query,
                            java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                            java.util.function.Function<javax.persistence.NoResultException,T> noResultExceptionCallback,
                            java.util.function.Function<javax.persistence.NonUniqueResultException,T> nonUniqueResultExceptionCallback)
        Execute a query and map the result to a DTO. Return a single result, if the query returns more than one record or no record, the exceptions of Query are thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        T - entity type
        Parameters:
        query - query after assigning parameters
        clazz - class to which you want to transform the result of the query
        noResultExceptionCallback - function that will be executed in the case that query does not get any results
        nonUniqueResultExceptionCallback - function that will be executed in the case that the query gets more than one result
        Returns:
        instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if query is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if it is called for an UPDATE or DELETE statement from the Java persistence query language
        javax.persistence.QueryTimeoutException - if the execution of the query exceeds the value of the query timeout and only the instruction is reversed
        javax.persistence.TransactionRequiredException - if a blocking mode other than NONE has been set and there is no transaction or the persistence context has not joined the transaction
        javax.persistence.PessimisticLockException - if the pessimistic blockade fails and the transaction is reversed
        javax.persistence.LockTimeoutException - if the pessimistic blockade fails and the transaction is reversed
        javax.persistence.PersistenceException - if the execution of the query exceeds the timeout value of the query and the transaction rolls back
        Since:
        2.1.0

        javax.persistence.QueryTimeoutException - if the execution of the query exceeds the value of the query timeout and only the instruction is reversed
        javax.persistence.TransactionRequiredException - if a blocking mode other than NONE has been set and there is no transaction or the persistence context has not joined the transaction
        javax.persistence.PessimisticLockException - if the pessimistic blockade fails and the transaction is reversed
        javax.persistence.LockTimeoutException - if the pessimistic blockade fails and the transaction is reversed
        javax.persistence.PersistenceException - if the execution of the query exceeds the timeout value of the query and the transaction rolls back
        Since:

      • mapToDTO

        @Nullable
private static <T> T mapToDTO(@NotNull(value="Map can\'t be null")
                                         @NotNull(value="Map can\'t be null") java.util.Map<org.eclipse.persistence.internal.helper.DatabaseField,?> map,
                                         @NotNull(value="Class can\'t be null")
                                         @NotNull(value="Class can\'t be null") java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Transforms a map returned by the Query in an instance of the class given by parameter.
        Type Parameters:
        T - entity type
        Parameters:
        map - map with the result of the query
        clazz - class to which you are going to map
        Returns:
        instance with map values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if map or class is null
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getField

        private static java.lang.reflect.Field getField(java.lang.String databaseField,
                                                @NotNull(value="Field list can\'t be null")
                                                @NotNull(value="Field list can\'t be null") java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Field> fields)
        Find matches between the name of the column and the name of the attribute. Regardless of whether it is camelCase or SNAKE_CASE.
        Parameters:
        databaseField - column name
        fields - list with the fields of the class
        Returns:
        the field of the class that matches, otherwise null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if field lists is null
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getNameField

        private static java.lang.String getNameField(@NotNull(value="QueryName is null")
                                             @NotNull(value="QueryName is null") java.lang.String queryName)
        Valid if the name of the column is in SNAKE_CASE and transforms it to camelCase and validates if they have the same value.
        Parameters:
        queryName - name of the query column
        Returns:
        transformed name of the column
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if queryName is null
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • objectToDTO

        private static <T> T objectToDTO(java.lang.Object o,
                                 java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Build the POJO from the data of the native query object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - entity type
        Parameters:
        o - object returned by the native query
        clazz - POJO class
        Returns:
        POJO with the information of the object
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the object can't be instantiated
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is no constructor for the query attributes

      • castParams

        private static java.lang.Object[] castParams(@NotNull(value="Attributes array can\'t be null")
                                             @NotNull(value="Attributes array can\'t be null") java.lang.Object[] p,
                                             java.lang.Class<?>[] classes)
        Cast each of the values to their respective class within the POJO.
        Parameters:
        p - array with the attributes of the native query object
        classes - array with the respective classes for each attribute
        Returns:
        array of objects with casted attributes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if attributes array is null
